entry.title: [wpt] Fix permission set in `wpt_internal/system-wake-lock/idlharness*`
entry.content:
The third argument to `test_driver.set_permission(...)` should be null

or `WindowProxy` [0]. The current `false` argument confuses the

`chromedriver` implementation of `testdriver.js`.



[0]: https://web-platform-tests.org/writing-tests/testdriver.html#permissions

entry.title: Allow ChildProcessMitigationLowBox test to run on Win11 ARM64 debug
entry.content:
On Win11 ARM64 emitting a DPLOG eventually causes the Csrss heap

to be accessed by Windows libraries. As tests run in Csrss lockdown

and failing to launch a process causes a DPLOG this means that this

test that expects to fail to launch a process cannot run in Win11

ARM64 debug configurations unless we disable Csrss lockdown for

this configuration.



Fixed: 1523707

Change-Id: I36f1bd1ee2e7ad990817b813ec00e7be69bbd7d5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5260985

Reviewed-by: Will Harris

Commit-Queue: Alex Gough

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1256574}

entry.title: viz: Refactor GpuVSyncBFS to be Windows only
entry.content:
Rename GpuVSyncBeginFrameSource to ExternalBeginFrameSourceWin and have

it directly talk to the VSyncThreadWin which allows us to remove several

layers of plumbing between the BFS and Presenter.



Minor cleanup of VSyncThreadWin to not use base::Singleton and use the

IDXGIDevice associated with DComp instead of assuming that it's always

the ANGLE D3D11 device. Also move the VSyncObserver interface into

VSyncThreadWin since that's the only place it's used.



No functional change is intended.



Bug: 1517690

Change-Id: I869a293668670947a25eec8c75cae419e808f52c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5262540

entry.title: Don’t adjust floated bounds when detached
entry.content:
This CL makes CCState do nothing if the window has no parent when a

workspace event happens. Otherwise, `FloatController::GetFloatWindow*`

crashes.

A window may have no parent when it’s being reparented to another

container.



BUG=b:322374826

TEST=ClientControlledStateTestClamshellAndTablet.ReplaceFloatedWindowWithFullscreenWindow

entry.title: Clean up install_attributes sources from userdataauth
entry.content:
We are moving out install_attributes interface out

of cryptohome and creating a new service named

device_management.

entry.title: [ozone/wayland] Fix half screen tiling geometry and rendering
entry.content:
If the initial bounds on launch are the same as the bounds that are

calculated based on new insets received during the configure event when

tiling the window to one half of the screen, ensure the geometry is

still updated even if only the insets have changed and the bounds haven't.



Also ensure that if the tiled edges change a re-layout and re-paint is

done so that the window border and decorations are updated, without

assuming a bounds change will trigger that.



Bug: 1470678, 1491727

entry.title: IDB: remove migration support for schema versions <3
entry.content:
Schema version 3 was introduced 10 years ago in 2014, so there is low

risk of data loss. Schema version 4 (as well as 5) is from 2020, so

there is some non-trivial risk of loss if we were to remove that

support, and this change cautiously retains the 3->4->5 paths.



This allows deleting some testing code which reaches into LevelDB

internals from layers that should not "know" about LevelDB.



[not new behavior] when a schema version is not recognized, it's

treated as corruption, meaning the database will be clobbered and

recreated.



Bug: 1474996

entry.title: Don't set up IPC when teardown is imminent
entry.content:
Skip setting up IPC in AgentSchedulingGroupHost::RenderProcessExited if

the method is invoked by RenderProcessHostImpl::Cleanup, since there

will definitely be no future render process to talk to.



The prior behavior of setting up mojo IPC only to immediately tear it

down would relatively frequently result in tearing down the mojo port

before the process of proxy collapse could be completed. Mojo core's

handling of a proxy closure like this is not cheap, since it requires

sending a broadcast to every single node in the system.



Bug: b:322919652

entry.title: cros: metrics: shill: add temporary captive portal metrics
entry.content:
In crrev/c/5267618, the platform splitted the following metrics by

technology starting from m123:

- Network.Shill.PortalDetector.CAPPORTSupported

- Network.Shill.PortalDetector.CAPPORTAdvertised



The typo in "PortalDetector" was already accounted for in

crrev/c/5223621. This patch removes the Technology suffix from the

temporary histograms defined in crrev/c/5223621. Since most results

are expected to be on WiFi, this will allow some continuity of tracking

the adoption of CAPPORT for m121 and m122.



As a result:

- m121, m122:

- Network.Shill.PortalDector.CAPPORTSupported

- Network.Shill.PortalDector.CAPPORTAdvertised

- m123+:

- Network.Shill.PortalDetector.CAPPORTSupported.$TECH

- Network.Shill.PortalDetector.CAPPORTAdvertised.$TECH



In addition, a typo corrected in crrev/c/5267618 is taken into account

here with two additional temporary histograms for:

- Network.Shill.PortalDetector.HTTPReponseCode.$TECH

- Network.Shill.PortalDetector.HTTPReponseContentLength.$TECH

These histograms can be removed after captive portal metrics data is not

needed for m121 and m122.



Bug: b/305129516

Test: None

entry.title: Add birch weather provider
entry.content:
Adds a birch item struct for weather, with some updates to the generic

BirchItem - adds an icon image model, and changes the title to u16

string.



Introduces birch weather provider, that uses ambient mode backend to

query current weather state - not using the ambient mode weather model

at this point so the network requests tags when downloading icon are

different, and eventually, the backend call will be updated to use a

different weather client ID. Also, birch currently does not use polling

for weather changes.



Still todo - check whether geolocation is enabled before requesting

weather.

entry.title: Use longer retry intervals when extension metadata requests fail
entry.content:
When CWSInfoService receives an errored response from the CWS server,

it retries the request every hour. This can result in a large number

of requests in some situations. This CL modifies the retry logic by

recording a fetch error timestamp. CWSInfoService will now wait for a

full fetch interval to elapse (since the last fetch error) before

attempting another fetch. The fetch interval already has some jitter

included so that the requests are staggered across clients.



Bug: 41497356

entry.title: Add a small cache to avoid synchronous IPC on iframe creation
entry.content:
Synchronous IPCs aren't ideal, we can add a small cache to avoid

them in most situations. The cache is first populated with 4 items

upon RenderThread initialization. When the cache has only two items

in it new ones are asynchronously requested from the browser. If

the cache is empty it will fall back to the synchronous request.

This is implemented as a feature flag since we'd like to conduct a

study to see if this impacts FCP/LCP.



Thanks to nasko@ who's discussion sparked this approach as opposed

to something more complex as discussed in

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1nu1aUc4_UiWeqwAQ0-mxTMP4S7pZmNBvs110GGMuZl8/edit



Bug: 41496222

entry.content:
Prior to this commit, if the destination FileSystemURL already existed

(and was 100 bytes long) but the diversion file only wrote 60 bytes,

then the resultant file would still be 100 bytes long (and its final 40

bytes would be the old content).



After this commit, the resultant file is 60 bytes long.

entry.title: TaskAttribution: Refactor APIs to remove ScriptState
entry.content:
This CL finishes refactoring TaskAttribution APIs now that CPED is

per-Isolate rather than per-Context. Specifically:

- Removes the RunningTask(ScriptState*) overload, passing the isolate

instead.

- Remove ScriptState* from OnCreateTaskScope() callback



For now we still need ScriptState for creating the TaskScope because a

v8::Context is needed to create the v8::Object we store in CPED, so

CreateTaskScope still takes a ScriptState.

entry.title: Fix failing CHECK with devtools window measuring soft-navs
entry.content:
There seem to be situations where a dom modification is reported to one

instance of a SoftNavigationHeuristics class, and then the paint for

that Node is reported to a different SoftNavigationHeuristics instance.



Because these are Supplements for LocalDOMWindow, we seem to be reporting painted nodes to a different window instance, specifically in cases where devtool is being rendered and the page is undergoing significant manipulation (i.e. mobile emulation, or lighthouse testing).



Change to disable soft-navs tracking for DevTools pages. Also add proper support for nullptr being returned instead of a SoftNavigationHeuristics instance, since this was only half guarded previously.

entry.title: Remove PdfScriptingApi usage in PDF layout tests
entry.content:
PdfScriptingApi is used to wait for the PDF load to complete before

running the layout tests. Remove this usage and just run the tests

immediately.

PDFExtensionJSTest, which runs the tests, already ensures the PDF has

fully loaded during test setup. This occurs in

pdf_extension_test_util::EnsurePDFHasLoaded().

entry.title: editor: modify lifetime of EditorTextInserter
entry.content:
Currently EditorTextInserter's lifetime is tied to that of

EditorSystemActuator which exists for the entire time the OrcaService is

active and connected. Thus EditorTextInserter exists until OrcaService

is disconnected.



This lifetime is fine, however it would make more sense for the

EditorTextInserter to only exist when a pending text insertion

operation is requested. It would also simplify the EditorTextInserter

class by removing any "resetting" logic required.



Given the above context, this CL attempts to scope the lifetime of

EditorTextInserter to only exist when a pending text insertion

operation needs to be carried out. It also renames EditorTextInserter

to EditorTextInsertion to align better with its new lifetime.



BUG=b:323411472

entry.title: PA: Fix transitive include of //build/build_config.h
entry.content:
I am investigating why the CQ is blocking:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5205331?checksRunsSelected=linux-rel&tab=checks



Apparently, some bots on Linux become much slower, causing global

timeout. The patch is a no-op. So I am supposing this is caused by

some missing //build/build_config.h that used to be transitively

included, but aren't after reordering some headers.o



Note: In practise this wasn't the issue. It is still worth fixing.



Script:

-------



```

tokens=$(cat build/build_config.h | sed -n "s/#define \([^\ ()]*\) /\1 /p" | cut -f1 -d\ )



for file in $(find base/allocator/partition_allocator/src/partition_alloc -name "*.h" -o -name "*.cc")

do

include_line=$(grep -n "build/build_config.h" "$file" | head -1 |cut -f1 -d:)

for token in $tokens

do

token_line=$(grep -n "$token" "$file" | head -1 | cut -f1 -d:)



if [[ "$token_line" == "" ]]

then

continue

fi



if [[ "$include_line" == "" ]]

then

echo "$file" -- "$token" -- " Missing include"

continue

fi



if [ "$include_line" -gt "$token_line" ]

then

echo "$file" -- "$token" -- " Token used before include: $include_line vs $token_line"

fi

done

done | sort | uniq -c | sort -rn

```



Output:

-------

```

2 base/allocator/partition_allocator/src/partition_alloc/partition_alloc_base/memory/ref_counted.cc -- ARCH_CPU_X86_FAMILY -- Missing include

1 base/allocator/partition_allocator/src/partition_alloc/partition_alloc_base/memory/ref_counted.cc -- ARCH_CPU_X86 -- Missing include

1 base/allocator/partition_allocator/src/partition_alloc/partition_alloc_base/ios/ios_util.h -- OS_IOS -- Missing include

1 base/allocator/partition_allocator/src/partition_alloc/page_allocator_internals_posix.cc -- ARCH_CPU_ARM64 -- Missing include

```



Bug: 1508847

Change-Id: I0b409fcb3baf08eedc54c86adad2eeb5f2c2dba5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5269103

Auto-Submit: Arthur Sonzogni

entry.title: Parameterize accessibility features api tests
entry.content:

so that they run with manifest v2 or v3. Note: we do not run any tests

entry.title: Fix dangling pointer in ResourcePoolTest
entry.content:
Problem:



Consider the following members of `ResourcePoolTest`:

- `context_provider_`

- `context_support_`



During test setup:

1. ResourcePoolTest creates a new `MockContextSupport` and stores a non-owning

pointer in the test class.

2. Transfers ownership of the support object to a new

`TestContextProvider`.

3. Stores these pointers `context_support_` (non-owning) and

`context_provider_` (owning) respectively.

4. During destruction of `ResourcePoolTest`, `context_provider_` is

destroyed before `context_support_`.



Note that:

- ResourcePoolTest declares these members in the order

`context_support_` then `context_provider_`, so their destructors

are called in the opposite order.

- `context_provider_` owns `context_support_`

- `ResourcePoolTest` owns `context_provider_` but only holds a pointer

to `context_support_` for easy access.



Solution:



Swapping the declaration order to mitigate the dangling pointer issue.



Bug: 1485833

Change-Id: Idcf588b052a894cbdbd40bee0a5206303a89c894

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5260164

Reviewed-by: Yaroslav Shalivskyy

Reviewed-by: Olga Gerchikov

Commit-Queue: Adam Ettenberger

Reviewed-by: Jonathan Ross

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1256422}

entry.title: Allow `auto` to refer to a type alias even if there's a pointer inside
entry.content:
stdlib iterators are type aliases which may be a pointer, or may be a

record type. This can change based on the build configuration and is an

implementation detail of the library.



Any code that works with string_view iterators right now must write

`auto*` which is not portable and prevents us from turning on bounded

iterators.



This loosens the `auto*` rule to allow writing `auto` to refer to a

deduced type which is an alias, even if the alias itself is of a

pointer type.



R=dcheng@chromium.org



Bug: 1519908

Change-Id: I8d34ac54bfb3aee31dbd8084ec3bf6764d5608b3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5255277

Original change's description:

> [A11y] Invalidate AXIDs when those objects are removed

>

> After CL:4185636, an AXObject may have been detached and recreated

> with the same DOM node, and therefore has the same id (the dom node id).

> This breaks the accessibility object caching mechanism used for web

> tests, which assumes that if it sees the same ID, it can assume the

> object is still the same one. The fix is to notify the caching

> mechanism of detached AXObjects so that it can invalidate the

> corresponding entries.

>

entry.title: Revert "Increase IdlePollingService interval to 15s"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 2ece01ea6ca750ff030d2552da16ac7093c69130.



Reason for revert:

LUCI Bisection has identified this change as the cause of a test failure. See the analysis: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/bisection/test-analysis/b/6330134757900288



Sample build with failed test: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8756908096979935201

Affected test(s):

[ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/IdleBrowserTest.Start](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2Fchrome%2Ftest:browser_tests%2FIdleBrowserTest.Start?q=VHash%3A4796b64b9e9259d1)



If this is a false positive, please report it at http://b.corp.google.com/createIssue?component=1199205&description=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fci.chromium.org%2Fui%2Fp%2Fchromium%2Fbisection%2Ftest-analysis%2Fb%2F6330134757900288&format=PLAIN&priority=P3&title=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F5258718&type=BUG



Original change's description:

> Increase IdlePollingService interval to 15s

>

> Polling every 1s is consuming more battery than necessary, and we don't

> need that level of granularity. 15s should be unnoticeable for most

> users, and reduces power consumption.

>

entry.title: [Hotspot] Decouple TetherHostResponseRecorder from ConnectTetheringOperation
entry.content:
This change removes the dependency on TetherHostResponseRecorder from

ConnectTetheringOperation, placing the responsibility of recording the

response onto the caller (TetherConnectorImpl).



This is done to reduce the scope of ConnectTetheringOperation, slimming

it down to just message exchange responsibilities. When there are multiple

implementations of ConnectTetheringOperation, this will make it easier to

avoid errors by moving as much code which is shared regardless of operation implementation to a common location



TEST=Modified tests to reflect new callsite, Manual Testing



Change-Id: I879e577d280364a0a25555d7afd7188e81602880

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5186399

Commit-Queue: Joe Antonetti

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1256399}
